steps.title: Launch & land on dashboard
details: Every scenario begins by opening http://localhost:5173 and landing on an empty/initial dashboard.
Visual QA repeatedly flags mis-aligned elements and inconsistent typography as early as the landing page.

steps.title: Try to add a new task
details: User opens the “Add Task” modal and fills in Name, Description, Deadline, Category and Emoji.
In Drag & Move Task the flow breaks – the Create Task button is clickable but a still-open categories pop-over intercepts the click (hard FAILURE).
Other ‘Add Task’ tests eventually succeed but testers note missing success toast or list refresh, so users are left guessing whether the task was really added.

steps.title: Manipulate existing tasks (move, complete, pin, view details, edit, delete, purge)
details: Moving a task fails early because the previous hard failure left no task to move (cascade).
Mark-as-done / Mark-as-not-done works but no in-app confirmation banner appears; testers rely on visual strike-through only.
Pinning, editing and deleting technically work yet many verification steps remain ‘pending’ because UI feedback is subtle or absent.
‘Purge all tasks’ succeeds, but multiple spelling errors (‘taks’) and no pre-delete warning copy diminish trust.

steps.title: Manage categories
details: Editing and favouriting categories succeed, but UI chrome (star icons, colour pickers) looks inconsistent and lacks spacing.
Adding a brand-new category (‘Hobby’) fails – form submits but list never updates (hard FAILURE).

steps.title: Change appearance settings
details: Theme toggles (Light / Dark / System) work, but ‘Auto’ and ‘Reduce Motion > System’ remain in pending state – testers could not prove behaviour.
Glow effect toggle lacks obvious visual feedback.

steps.title: Attempt to install the PWA
details: Safari tester cannot find any ‘Install App’ affordance; all subsequent steps (launch, offline check) fail.

emotional_arc: Starts with mild optimism (clean empty state) → grows into frustration as small layout issues pile up → reaches high frustration when critical actions (‘Create Task’, ‘Add Category’, PWA install) silently fail or give no feedback → partial relief when some actions work (edit, theme change) but confidence never fully recovers.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Without visible toasts or list refresh, users are unsure if their action succeeded, leading to repeated clicks or abandonment.
next_actions: Add success/failure toast for Create, Edit, Delete, Pin, Purge, Category add.
Auto-close modals and refresh lists after successful mutation.
Provide non-blocking loading spinners when network call in flight.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Open pop-overs (category menu) block clicks on underlying buttons, causing hard test and user failures.
next_actions: Auto-close pop-overs when user clicks outside them.
Disable underlying CTA while overlay is open (or move it above z-layer).
Write integration test reproducing the intercepted click bug.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Inconsistent fonts, padding and button styles erode brand trust and make UI feel unfinished.
next_actions: Adopt a design-token scale for typography and spacing and apply via global style sheet.
Run a one-time pass with linters / style-lint to normalise margins and paddings.
Audit all buttons for size, border-radius, colour and hover state; convert to shared component.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Misspellings (‘taks’), unclear hierarchy and low-contrast colours hurt credibility and accessibility compliance.
next_actions: Pass all static copy through spell-checker; add i18n strings to catch future typos.
Meet WCAG AA colour-contrast for text on backgrounds.
Use semantic headings (<h1-h3>) to establish hierarchy.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Core data-entry flows occasionally fail (category not persisted, task not added) – a show-stopper for productivity app.
next_actions: Add front-end form validation and disable Submit until required fields valid.
Return server error details to UI and display them inside modal.
Add e2e test that asserts new item appears in list after POST.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Promised ‘Install App’ feature missing confuses users and testers, and blocks offline use goal.
next_actions: Add PWA manifest & service-worker; serve over https; include display: standalone & install prompt handler.
Show ‘Install’ option in in-app menu when criteria met; hide otherwise to avoid dead ends.
Document install steps for each browser.

first_tackles.description: Fix overlay-intercepts-CTA bug on Create Task (close dropdown or raise z-index). This unblocks primary flow.
Add toast/snackbar confirmations for all CRUD actions so users instantly know the result.
Run spell-check and correct visible typos (‘taks’, ‘Catgeory’) to improve perceived quality in minutes.
Standardise button component and apply uniform padding/margin classes – quick CSS refactor with high visual payoff.
Expose or remove the ‘Install App’ option until PWA criteria are fully met to avoid confusion.
